page.title: 01SURVEY KILDRUMMY
page.content: Kildrummy is part of the Don valley in Aberrdeenshire. It is hilly grass lands which are cultivated in small farms. I n the centre lies the ruins of a 13th century castle. Overlooking the castle is a hotel the grounds of which have been laid out in a very attractive garden. Further south on the main road is an old Inn. The Parish Church stands on a hillock on the east of the main road. Beside the church is the remains of the pre_ reformation church of St. Bride.The School stands on the other side of the main roadnorth of the church To the east of the main road,south of the church, is the little hamlet of Milltown of Kildrummy.
